datafield.subfield: 283 x 170 mm bound to 294 x 184 mm.
Described in: La Geste de Monglane. Eugene, Or. : University of Oregon Books, 1966

Bookplate with coat of arms mounted on inside cover reads: Bibliotheca Phillippica. From the collection formed by Sir Thomas Phillipps Br., 1792-1872, purchased by private treaty by William H. Robinson Ltd., Pall Mall, London; Pencilled above bookplate: Phillipps Ms. 26092.
Manuscript originally purchased by Sir Thomas Phillips in 1861 and added to his collection at Cheltenham as no. 26,092. Subsequently purchased by the University of Oregon in 1956.
Manduscript codex comprising a medieval epic poem, containing segments of the cycle of Guillaume d'Orange.
Also known as: The Cheltenham manuscript.
Manuscript comprises 229 vellum folios and has five distinct parts. The 1st two folios are missing; At the end of the 2nd part, Renier de Gennes, eight folios are missing. These were missing in 1883.
Half page at end may contain former ownership information.

Layout: Single column in short lines from f. 1a to f. 136a and f. 191a to f. 192a; long lines from f. 137a to 190a and f. 192b to f. 224a. Margins and lines ruled in brown ink, some rubricated lines. Some pages have pricking at outer foredge; pages have been trimmed. Occasional marginal notes by scribe, and some later entries in another, looser hand.

Script: Written in ink in lettres bâtardes, with flourishes in brown ink, and extended decorative ink flourishes at top of page. Some upper swashes and some capital letters are accented with yellow-brown wash. Capitals in gold and colors.

Decoration: At least one to four small decorative initials per page: burnished gold letter on counterchanged pink and blue ground with white highlights. f. 138b 2 sm. initials and 6 very small initials. f. 137a Four-sided illuminated border: 30 x 25 mm initial 'A' in pink, filled with red and blue leaves on spiral stems, on a background of burnished gold. Initial extends in a vertical bar in gold, red, and blue, sprouting burnished gold leaves in trefoil and spearhead shapes on black ink stems; top extends vertically into pink and blue acanthus, and extends across the top edge in burnished gold leaves and a pink rose and a blue forget-me-not, all on ink stems. Bottom and foredge have a band of alternating red and blue with white tracery and occasional burnished gold accents, sprouting gold leaves on ink outlines, with pink flowers, blue forget-me-not, and blue bachelor's buttons. Center of foredge and lower right corner have blue and red acanthus. Lower left corner has blue forget-me-nots on green stems and leaves. Text a smaller gold initial on red and blue with white tracery, followed by 2 lines of rubrication at top and one line in center. f. 141b Four-sided illuminated border: At top, 11 very small burnished gold initials on pink and blue with white tracery. Midway down page: 25 x 20 mm initial 'A' in blue with white tracery, filled with red and blue leaves on spiral stems, on a background of burnished gold. Foredge and bottom edge have band of alternating red and blue with white tracery and occasional burnished gold accents, sprouting gold leaves on ink outlines, with blue bachelor's buttons, blue forget-me-nots, and pink roses. Gutter edge has a vertical bar in gold, red, and blue, sprouting burnished gold leaves on ink stems. Upper right and lower left corners have blue and red acanthus. To left of 'A' are pink and white thistles on green stems and leaves. In upper left corner, pink roses on green stems and leaves. Lower right corner, blue forget-me-nots on green stems and leaves. f. 143b One calligraphic ascender flourish includes an unusual stylized human face in brown ink. f. 148b 9 small initials. f. 149a 17 small initials. f. 149b 13 sm. initials. f.183a 17 sm. initials, f. 191b 29 very small initials, f. 192a 33 very small initials. f. 150a 2 rubricated lines followed by large burnished gold initial 'A' on pink and blue background (water-damaged). f. 191a 3 rubricated lines, the top line with ascender flourishes, and 26 very small initials.
On spine: Geste de Monglane. Manuscript on vellum.

Binding: Modern brown leather. Each cover has a gold outline. Six-panelled spine with raised bands and gold letters: "Geste de Montglane" and "Manuscript on vellum". Silk head and tail bands in brown, green, and white. Cover interiors have three nested gold rectangles. Inside front cover gold stamped letters: "Bound by Sangorski and Sutcliffe, London, England." Parchment pastedowns and three flyleaves of modern parchment at front and back.
Shelfmark: Eugene, OR, Special Collections and University Archives, University of Oregon, MS 065.

Hernaut de Beaulande (folios 1a-35a) -- Renier de Gennes (folios 35a-46b) -- Girart de Vienne (folios 47a-83b) -- Galiens li restorés (folios 83b-135b) -- La Chronique de Saint-Denis (folios 137a-224a).
